AUTHOR: me
COPY:
Ok universe, I get it.

If this is some crazy lesson to get me to appreciate life more, I get it. I do. Really.

Please, please I beg of you. Please stop. I’ve learned my lesson. Please, I beg of you, please don’t be cancer.

……

AUTHOR: negative
COPY: In shock.

AUTHOR: me
COPY:
I guess you can’t blame them. They’ve spent their lives teaching people how to prevent cancer.

Their own little girl was just diagnosed. How do you think they'd feel?

Grandma died from breast cancer. I can’t even imagine what dad’s going through.

AUTHOR: me
COPY: Everything's going in slow motion.

AUTHOR: positive
COPY: You need time to digest this. Go out for a walk. Go to where people are. Take deep breaths.

AUTHOR: positive
COPY: It's not the end of the world.

AUTHOR: me
COPY: Welp. I just broke down crying in a public restaurant.

AUTHOR: me
COPY: Is this what it's going to be like from now on?

AUTHOR: positive
COPY:
It could be.

Or it could be like this:

Besides grandma, everyone else you know has survived from cancer. And they’ve survived well.

You’re not dead yet. And you probably won’t die. Cancer isn’t a death sentence. 

You’re going to be okay.

AUTHOR: positive
COPY:
Take advantage of this opportunity and turn this into something meaningful. An art piece, a time to grow, a chance to empathize with people are going through their own painful experiences.

You’re going to understand a pain that most people have never been through.

And you’re going to be so much better because of it.

AUTHOR: positive
COPY: How you take these things are up to you.

AUTHOR: negative
COPY: Just try not to be annoying about it.

AUTHOR: me

AUTHOR: me
COPY: Have I discovered what will eventually kill me?

AUTHOR: positive
COPY: Nah. You've discovered the thing that will make you feel the most alive.

AUTHOR: positive
COPY: Besides, I've lived a life with no regrets and always went for everything I wanted...even if I was to die...it'd be okay.

AUTHOR: me
COPY: I worry when I see my mom putting on a positive face and telling me that taking care of me is no big deal, but then seeing her passed out sleeping on the bed mid-day.

AUTHOR: positive
COPY: The best way to deal with shitty doctors appointments is to dress in your favorite clothes.

AUTHOR: negative

AUTHOR: negative
COPY:
I’ve been so good.

I don’t drink, I never do drugs, I never eat fast food and drink only green tea and water. I eat organic and rarely eat meat.

I don’t even drink coffee.

I exercise regularly, I keep a positive mindset. I go to sleep and wake up on a regular schedule. I don't even own a fucking microwave.

I do everything the goddamn book says.

EVERYTHING.

And out of EVERYONE, this has to happen to me.

AUTHOR: negative
COPY: It's like I'm suffering for everything I did right, while everyone else is out having the time of their lives.

AUTHOR: me
COPY: Well, that's unfair. We don't really know what causes cancer yet besides mutations in cells. All that other stuff are just possible minor factors.

AUTHOR: positive
COPY: It's easy to look at how shitty things are right now.

AUTHOR: positive
COPY: Everyone always says that you're going to be better because of it. I know it's hard to remember when it sucks so much right now, but five years from now it'll all be a blur.
